byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Gardiner Harris, Nida Najar, Hari Kumar and Suhasini Raj from New Delhi; Ellen Barry and Bhadra Sharma from Katmandu; and Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By THOMAS FULLER and CHRIS BUCKLEY

abstract: Millions of Nepalese are living outdoors in wake of massive earthquake, struggling to cope with heavy rain, food shortages, disease and intense aftershocks that continue to convulse area around Katmandu; residents are focused on immediate survival as authorities and rescue workers begin to discover extent of death and destruction; international relief effort has begun, but logistics of getting aid to those in need remain daunting.
lead_paragraph: Residents were on a difficult search for safety in Katmandu, where thousands have died and homes and temples have been reduced to rubble.

headline.main: Earthquake Aftershocks Jolt Nepal as Death Toll Rises Above 3,400
headline.print_headline: Aftershocks Jolt Katmandu, and ‘Everyone Is Scared’

snippet: Residents were on a difficult search for safety in Katmandu, where thousands have died and homes and temples have been reduced to rubble.
